system_prompt:
As an experienced data analyst, based on the provided database schema and user query, create main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types that answer key aspects of the data storytelling plan.

Ensure all main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types meet these criterias:

Generate main questions and main chart titles related to the narrative flow of the data story.
Be free from redundant questions and informations.
Each main question and main chart title should result in a visualization containing up to 12 rows when converted into an SQL query.
Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

SELECT the MOST SUITABLE main chart type ONLY from the supported chart type list below.

- barlinecombo_chart
- line_chart
- spline_chart
- bar_chart
- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

You are provided Data Story Telling Plan, Database Schema SQL, Table Description, and Column Description for additional context.

Data Story Telling Plan:
StorySkeleton(objectives='The goal of this analysis is to compare the Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) for the Mobile and Broadband products on a monthly basis to identify which product is more profitable.', storytelling_flow='Comparative Flow', audiences='Senior management, business analysts, and decision-makers in the telecommunications industry, particularly those in the department responsible for product strategy and financial performance evaluation.', narrative_flow='Begin by setting the context with the total revenue and cost for both Mobile and Broadband products in January 2022. Then, introduce the EBIT for each product, highlighting the differences. Follow this up with a similar comparison for February 2022. Summarize the findings by comparing the average EBIT for both products across the two months, providing insights into which product generates higher operational profitability.', assumptions=['A higher EBIT indicates a more profitable product, assuming that the scale of operations and market conditions are similar for both Mobile and Broadband products.', 'The Cost column accurately reflects the direct costs associated with producing or acquiring the Mobile and Broadband products.'], scope='This analysis is limited to the Mobile and Broadband products and the months of January and February 2022. The EBIT calculations are based on the provided Revenue, Cost, and Date columns.', context='This data story applies to the telecommunications industry, focusing on the department responsible for product strategy and financial performance evaluation.', possible_insights=['The Mobile product may have a higher average EBIT than the Broadband product, indicating greater profitability.', 'The Broadband product may have a higher average EBIT than the Mobile product, suggesting that it is more profitable.'], possible_outcomes=['The insights derived from this analysis could influence product strategy, pricing decisions, and resource allocation between the Mobile and Broadband product lines.', 'The findings may encourage further investigation into the factors contributing to the profitability differences between the two products, potentially leading to improvements in operational efficiency or cost management.'])

Database Schema:
CREATE TABLE "starhub_data_asset.data_asset_001_ta" (
    `Revenue` int,
    `Product` text,
    `Cost` int,
    `Date` text,
    `EBIT` int
);

/* Given the following database description: */
 This fact table stores transactional data related to business assets, with columns for Product, Date, Revenue, Cost, and EBIT. It captures financial performance metrics for individual products over time. The Date column provides a timestamp for each record, while Revenue and Cost columns enable the calculation of profitability. EBIT, or Earnings Before Interest and Taxes, is a key performance indicator tracked in this table, offering valuable insights into operational profitability.

/* Given the following database column description: */
Revenue: The Revenue column in data_asset_001_ta displays the total income generated by the sale of goods or services during a specific period.
Product: The Product column lists the specific product or service that the financial data pertains to.
Cost: The Cost column in data_asset_001_ta shows the total cost associated with producing or acquiring the specified product.
Date: The Date column represents the date on which the financial data was recorded.
EBIT: EBIT, or Earnings Before Interest and Taxes, is a measure of a company's profitability and represents the earnings before taking into account interest expenses and tax payments.


Limit the scope of the main questions to the filter below.
'Product' = ['Mobile', 'Broadband']
'Date' = ['2022-01-01', '2022-02-01']




Aggregate the chart planned under each main question by EBIT columns.

'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pyramidfunnel_chart', and 'pie_chart' consist of 'xAxis' and 'yAxis' columns only where 'xAxis' must be from a database column with string / numerical / date data type, and 'yAxis' must be from a database column with numerical data type.
    'histogram_chart' consist of 'xAxis' column only where 'xAxis' must be from a database column with numerical data type.
    'area_chart', 'line_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', 'grouped_bar_chart', 'radar_chart', and 'TreemapMulti_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxis', 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' columns only. 'xAxis' must from a database column with string / numerical / date data type, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' column is not mandatory.
    'spline_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxis', 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' columns only. 'xAxis' must from a database column with numerical / date data type only, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' column is not mandatory.
    'barlinecombo_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxisBar', 'yAxisLine' columns only.
    'table_chart' consist of all columns needed by the question.

User Query: Compare the Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) for the Mobile and Broadband products on a monthly basis to identify which product is more profitable.

[{"main_question": "...", "main_title": "...", "main_chart_type": "..."}, {"main_question": "...", "main_title": "...", "main_chart_type": "..."}, ..]
expected_output:

  {"main_question": "What percentage of the total EBIT does each product represent?", "main_title": "EBIT Percentage: Mobile and Broadband", "main_chart_type": "pie_chart"},
  {"main_question": "What is the distribution of EBIT for Mobile and Broadband products?", "main_title": "EBIT Distribution: Mobile and Broadband", "main_chart_type": "histogram_chart"},
  {"main_question": "What is the trend in EBIT for Mobile and Broadband products over time?", "main_title": "EBIT Trend: Mobile and Broadband", "main_chart_type": "line_chart"}
]

Break down the costs by date to recognize any trends or patterns in cost development over time. Lastly, calculate the EBIT margin for each product to assess their individual profitability.', assumptions=['Products with higher costs may have lower EBIT margins, indicating a need for cost optimization.', 'A decrease in costs for a product could lead to an increase in its EBIT margin and overall profitability.'], scope='This analysis focuses on the cost structure of different products, excluding other business aspects such as marketing expenses and tax implications.', context='This data story applies to the telecommunications industry, specifically within the product management and finance departments.', possible_insights=['Identification of high-cost products that require cost optimization measures.', 'Recognition of low-cost products that could serve as benchmarks for cost-efficiency.', 'Understanding of cost trends and patterns to inform future product development and pricing strategies.'], possible_outcomes=['Implementation of cost-saving initiatives for high-cost products.', 'Adoption of best practices from low-cost products to improve overall cost-efficiency.', 'Informed decision-making on product development and pricing strategies based on cost trends and patterns.'])

Database Schema:
CREATE TABLE "starhub_data_asset.data_asset_001_ta" (
    `Revenue` int,
    `Product` text,
    `Cost` int,
    `Date` text,
    `EBIT` int
);

/* Given the following database description: */
 This fact table stores transactional data related to business assets, with columns for Product, Date, Revenue, Cost, and EBIT. It captures financial performance metrics for individual products over time. The Date column provides a timestamp for each record, while Revenue and Cost columns enable the calculation of profitability. EBIT, or Earnings Before Interest and Taxes, is a key performance indicator tracked in this table, offering valuable insights into operational profitability.

/* Given the following database column description: */
Revenue: The Revenue column in data_asset_001_ta displays the total income generated by the sale of goods or services during a specific period.
Product: The Product column lists the specific product or service that the financial data pertains to.
Cost: The Cost column in data_asset_001_ta shows the total cost associated with producing or acquiring the specified product.
Date: The Date column represents the date on which the financial data was recorded.
EBIT: EBIT, or Earnings Before Interest and Taxes, is a measure of a company's profitability and represents the earnings before taking into account interest expenses and tax payments.




Always use the database columns below in each main question.
'Product'


Aggregate the chart planned under each main question by Cost columns.

'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pyramidfunnel_chart', and 'pie_chart' consist of 'xAxis' and 'yAxis' columns only where 'xAxis' must be from a database column with string / numerical / date data type, and 'yAxis' must be from a database column with numerical data type.
    'histogram_chart' consist of 'xAxis' column only where 'xAxis' must be from a database column with numerical data type.
    'area_chart', 'line_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', 'grouped_bar_chart', 'radar_chart', and 'TreemapMulti_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxis', 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' columns only. 'xAxis' must from a database column with string / numerical / date data type, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' column is not mandatory.
    'spline_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxis', 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' columns only. 'xAxis' must from a database column with numerical / date data type only, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' column is not mandatory.

system_prompt:
As an experienced data analyst, based on the provided database schema and user query, create main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types that answer key aspects of the data storytelling plan.

Ensure all main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types meet these criterias:

Generate main questions and main chart titles related to the narrative flow of the data story.
Be free from redundant questions and informations.
Each main question and main chart title should result in a visualization containing up to 12 rows when converted into an SQL query.
Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

SELECT the MOST SUITABLE main chart type ONLY from the supported chart type list below.

- barlinecombo_chart
- line_chart
- spline_chart
- bar_chart
- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

You are provided Data Story Telling Plan, Database Schema SQL, Table Description, and Column Description for additional context.

system_prompt:
As an experienced data analyst, based on the provided database schema and user query, create main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types that answer key aspects of the data storytelling plan.

Ensure all main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types meet these criterias:

Generate main questions and main chart titles related to the narrative flow of the data story.
Be free from redundant questions and informations.
Each main question and main chart title should result in a visualization containing up to 12 rows when converted into an SQL query.
Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

SELECT the MOST SUITABLE main chart type ONLY from the supported chart type list below.

- barlinecombo_chart
- line_chart
- spline_chart
- bar_chart
- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

Never start the sub questions with `which`.

NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

CREATE TABLE "starhub_data_asset.data_asset_001_ta" (

);

/* Given the following database description: */
 This fact table stores transactional data related to business assets, with columns for Product, Date, Revenue, Cost, and EBIT. It captures financial performance metrics for individual products over time. The Date column provides a timestamp for each record, while Revenue and Cost columns enable the calculation of profitability. EBIT, or Earnings Before Interest and Taxes, is a key performance indicator tracked in this table, offering valuable insights into operational profitability.

/* Given the following database column description: */
Revenue: The Revenue column in data_asset_001_ta displays the total income generated by the sale of goods or services during a specific period.
Product: The Product column lists the specific product or service that the financial data pertains to.
Cost: The Cost column in data_asset_001_ta shows the total cost associated with producing or acquiring the specified product.
Date: The Date column represents the date on which the financial data was recorded.
EBIT: EBIT, or Earnings Before Interest and Taxes, is a measure of a company's profitability and represents the earnings before taking into account interest expenses and tax payments.

'xAxis' must from a database column with numerical / date data type only, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. StorySkeleton(objectives='The primary objective is to identify the months with the highest and lowest EBIT for all products, in order to recognize seasonal trends in profitability.', storytelling_flow='Temporal Flow', audiences='Senior management, finance department, and product managers', narrative_flow='We begin by examining the monthly EBIT trends across all products. Database Schema:
CREATE TABLE "starhub_data_asset.data_asset_001_kpm" (
    `Product` text,
    `Cost_to_Revenue_Ratio` double,
    `Earning_per_Cost` double,
    `Date` text,
    `Revenue_Percent_Change` double,
    `EBIT_Margin` double
);

/* Given the following database description: */
 This fact table stores data about various products, including their revenue percent change, cost-to-revenue ratio, EBIT margin, and earnings per cost. Each record represents a specific product at a given date, providing a historical view of product performance. The table is a crucial component for financial analysis, allowing for insights into revenue trends, cost structures, and profitability. It can be used to identify high-performing and underperforming products, informing strategic decision-making and resource allocation.

/* Given the following database column description: */
Product: The Product column identifies the specific products associated with each financial record. It can help to analyze the financial performance of different products.
Cost_to_Revenue_Ratio: The Cost_to_Revenue_Ratio indicates the proportion of revenue spent on costs in a given period. It is a measure of a company's operational efficiency.
Earning_per_Cost: Earning per Cost is a measure of the profit generated per unit of cost. It provides information on the efficiency of a company's operations.
Date: The Date column contains the date of the financial data being recorded. It helps to track financial performance over time.
Revenue_Percent_Change: Revenue Percent Change shows the percentage change in revenue between two consecutive periods. It is a useful indicator of revenue growth or decline.
EBIT_Margin: EBIT Margin (Earnings Before Interest and Taxes Margin) is the ratio of EBIT to revenue, representing the company's profitability before accounting for interest and taxes.

StorySkeleton(objectives='The goal of this analysis is to examine the monthly trend of earnings per cost for Broadband and Mobile products, aiming to identify any seasonal variations that could inform strategic decision-making and resource allocation within the telecommunications industry, specifically for the department managing these two product lines.', storytelling_flow='Exploratory Flow', audiences='Senior management and department heads within the telecommunications industry, particularly those responsible for managing Broadband and Mobile product lines.', narrative_flow='Beginning with an overview of the total earnings per cost for both Broadband and Mobile products, we will delve into the individual performance of each product line. By comparing their respective cost-to-revenue ratios and EBIT margins, we can identify any discrepancies that may influence earnings per cost. Further examination of revenue percent change will reveal trends and fluctuations in revenue growth. Ultimately, this analysis will highlight any seasonal variations in earnings per cost for both product lines.', assumptions=['A higher cost-to-revenue ratio in a given month may lead to a lower earnings per cost for that month, assuming all other factors remain constant.', 'A positive revenue percent change could contribute to an increase in earnings per cost, provided that the cost-to-revenue ratio remains stable or decreases.'], scope='This analysis will focus on the monthly earnings per cost trend for Broadband and Mobile products, limiting the scope to the specified product lines and a twelve-month period to ensure the validity of seasonal variation assumptions.', context='This data story applies to the telecommunications industry, focusing on the department responsible for managing Broadband and Mobile product lines.', possible_insights=['Identification of specific months with higher or lower earnings per cost for each product line.', 'Detection of any correlation between cost-to-revenue ratio, EBIT margin, and revenue percent change and their impact on earnings per cost.', 'Uncovering seasonal trends in earnings per cost that can inform strategic planning and resource allocation.'], possible_outcomes=['Adjustments to pricing strategies or promotional activities during periods of lower earnings per cost to maintain profitability.', 'Increased focus on cost optimization during months with higher cost-to-revenue ratios to protect earnings per cost.', 'Informed decision-making on product development and marketing efforts based on seasonal trends in earnings per cost.'])

Earning_per_Cost: Earning per Cost is a measure of the profit generated per unit of cost. It provides information on the efficiency of a company's operations.
Date: The Date column contains the date of the financial data being recorded. It helps to track financial performance over time.
Revenue_Percent_Change: Revenue Percent Change shows the percentage change in revenue between two consecutive periods. It is a useful indicator of revenue growth or decline.
EBIT_Margin: EBIT Margin (Earnings Before Interest and Taxes Margin) is the ratio of EBIT to revenue, representing the company's profitability before accounting for interest and taxes.

Ensure all main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types meet these criterias:

Generate main questions and main chart titles related to the narrative flow of the data story.
Be free from redundant questions and informations.
Each main question and main chart title should result in a visualization containing up to 12 rows when converted into an SQL query.
Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

SELECT the MOST SUITABLE main chart type ONLY from the supported chart type list below.

- barlinecombo_chart
- line_chart
- spline_chart
- bar_chart
- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

StorySkeleton(objectives='The goal of this analysis is to compare the earning per cost of Entertainment and BroadBand products during Q1 and Q2 in 2022, in order to identify any trends or variations in profitability between the two product categories over time.', storytelling_flow='Comparative Flow', audiences='Senior management, financial analysts, and product managers within the telecommunications industry who are interested in understanding the financial performance of Entertainment and BroadBand products.', narrative_flow='Beginning with an overview of the average earning per cost for Entertainment and BroadBand products in Q1 2022, we will then compare these figures with the average earning per cost for the same products in Q2 2022. This will involve examining the individual records for each product, calculating the average earning per cost for each category, and visualizing the results using a line chart or bar graph. We will also consider the cost-to-revenue ratio and EBIT margin for each product category, as well as the revenue percent change between consecutive periods, in order to provide a more comprehensive view of financial performance.', assumptions=['A higher earning per cost indicates greater profitability for a product, while a lower cost-to-revenue ratio suggests more efficient use of resources. A positive revenue percent change indicates growth, while a negative change suggests decline.'], scope='The analysis will focus on the Entertainment and BroadBand product categories, and will cover the first two quarters of 2022. Other product categories and time periods will not be considered in this analysis.', context="This data story applies to the telecommunications industry, and more specifically to the financial performance of Entertainment and BroadBand products within a company's product portfolio.", possible_insights=['The Entertainment product category may have a higher earning per cost than the BroadBand category, indicating greater profitability. The cost-to-revenue ratio for Entertainment may be lower than for BroadBand, suggesting more efficient use of resources. The revenue percent change for Entertainment may be positive, indicating growth, while the change for BroadBand may be negative, suggesting decline.'], possible_outcomes=['Senior management may allocate more resources to the Entertainment product category based on its higher profitability and efficient use of resources. Product managers may consider strategies to improve the financial performance of the BroadBand category, such as reducing costs or increasing revenue. Financial analysts may use this analysis to inform future financial forecasting and strategic planning efforts.'])

Earning_per_Cost: Earning per Cost is a measure of the profit generated per unit of cost. It provides information on the efficiency of a company's operations.
Date: The Date column contains the date of the financial data being recorded. It helps to track financial performance over time.
Revenue_Percent_Change: Revenue Percent Change shows the percentage change in revenue between two consecutive periods. It is a useful indicator of revenue growth or decline.
EBIT_Margin: EBIT Margin (Earnings Before Interest and Taxes Margin) is the ratio of EBIT to revenue, representing the company's profitability before accounting for interest and taxes.

system_prompt:
As an experienced data analyst, based on the provided database schema and user query, create main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types that answer key aspects of the data storytelling plan.

Ensure all main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types meet these criterias:

Generate main questions and main chart titles related to the narrative flow of the data story.
Be free from redundant questions and informations.
Each main question and main chart title should result in a visualization containing up to 12 rows when converted into an SQL query.
Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

SELECT the MOST SUITABLE main chart type ONLY from the supported chart type list below.

- barlinecombo_chart
- line_chart
- spline_chart
- bar_chart
- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

As an experienced data analyst, based on the provided database schema and user query, create main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types that answer key aspects of the data storytelling plan.

Ensure all main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types meet these criterias:

Generate main questions and main chart titles related to the narrative flow of the data story.
Be free from redundant questions and informations.
Each main question and main chart title should result in a visualization containing up to 12 rows when converted into an SQL query.
Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

SELECT the MOST SUITABLE main chart type ONLY from the supported chart type list below.

- barlinecombo_chart
- line_chart
- spline_chart
- bar_chart
- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

You are provided Data Story Telling Plan, Database Schema SQL, Table Description, and Column Description for additional context.

Data Story Telling Plan:
StorySkeleton(objectives="The primary objective is to identify products that have generated profitability above the company's average in the last quarter, providing insights for strategic decision-making and resource allocation.", storytelling_flow='Comparative Flow', audiences='Senior management, product managers, and financial analysts who are responsible for making data-driven decisions regarding product strategy and financial planning.', narrative_flow="Beginning with an overview of the company's average product profitability, we will delve into the specific products with profitability above this threshold in the last quarter. We will analyze their revenue generation, cost efficiency, and overall profitability to understand their impact on the company's financial performance. This analysis will reveal trends, strengths, and potential areas for improvement, ultimately supporting informed decision-making.", assumptions=['Products with profitability above the company average are likely to have a positive impact on overall financial performance.', "Improving cost efficiency in high-profitability products could further enhance the company's financial position."], scope='This analysis will focus on products with profitability above the company average in the last quarter, excluding other factors such as market trends, customer preferences, and external influences.', context='This data story applies to the telecommunications industry, specifically within the product management and financial analysis departments.', possible_insights=['Identification of specific products driving financial success.', 'Understanding of the relationship between revenue generation, cost efficiency, and product profitability.', 'Awareness of areas for improvement in product strategies.'], possible_outcomes=['Resource reallocation towards high-profitability products.', 'Informed decision-making for future product development.', 'Enhanced financial performance through strategic planning.'])

Database Schema:
CREATE TABLE "starhub_data_asset.data_asset_001_pcc" (
    `Product` text,
    `Revenue_Generation` int,
    `Cost_Efficiency` double,
    `Product_Profitability` double,
    `Date` text
);

/* Given the following database description: */
 This fact table stores data related to product performance, tracking metrics such as revenue generation, cost efficiency, and product profitability. Each row represents a unique combination of product and date, providing a detailed view of performance over time. The table is a core component for financial and operational analysis, enabling data-driven decision-making for product strategy and resource allocation. By offering a quantitative perspective on product success, it supports the identification of trends, strengths, and areas for improvement.

/* Given the following database column description: */
Product: The Product column identifies the specific product or service being analyzed for cost efficiency, product profitability, and revenue generation.
Revenue_Generation: Revenue_Generation represents the total income generated by a product or service, typically measured over a specific period of time.
Cost_Efficiency: Cost_Efficiency indicates the cost-effectiveness of a product or process, reflecting the balance between the resources used and the outcomes achieved.
Product_Profitability: Product_Profitability measures the profitability of a particular product, reflecting the difference between its revenues and costs.
Date: The Date column represents the specific timepoint for which the cost efficiency, product profitability, and revenue generation data are reported.


Limit the scope of the main questions to the filter below.
'Product_Profitability' = ['above average']


Always use the database columns below in each main question.
'Date'




'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pyramidfunnel_chart', and 'pie_chart' consist of 'xAxis' and 'yAxis' columns only where 'xAxis' must be from a database column with string / numerical / date data type, and 'yAxis' must be from a database column with numerical data type.
    'histogram_chart' consist of 'xAxis' column only where 'xAxis' must be from a database column with numerical data type.
    'area_chart', 'line_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', 'grouped_bar_chart', 'radar_chart', and 'TreemapMulti_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxis', 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' columns only. 'xAxis' must from a database column with string / numerical / date data type, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' column is not mandatory.
    'spline_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxis', 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' columns only. 'xAxis' must from a database column with numerical / date data type only, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' column is not mandatory.
    'barlinecombo_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxisBar', 'yAxisLine' columns only.
    'table_chart' consist of all columns needed by the question.

Generate main questions and main chart titles related to the narrative flow of the data story.
Be free from redundant questions and informations.
Each main question and main chart title should result in a visualization containing up to 12 rows when converted into an SQL query.
Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

SELECT the MOST SUITABLE main chart type ONLY from the supported chart type list below.

- barlinecombo_chart
- line_chart
- spline_chart
- bar_chart
- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

StorySkeleton(objectives='The primary objective is to identify any outliers in the cost efficiency data across all products, which will help in understanding the financial performance of each product and making informed decisions for resource allocation or improvement strategies.', storytelling_flow='Exploratory Flow', audiences='Senior management, product managers, and financial analysts who are responsible for making strategic decisions regarding product development and resource allocation.', narrative_flow='We will begin by examining the cost efficiency data for each product, looking at trends and patterns over time. By comparing the cost efficiency of different products, we can identify any significant differences or anomalies. Drilling down to the product level, we will analyze individual data points to determine if there are any outliers that warrant further investigation. This analysis will be supported by relevant metrics and dimensions, including Product, Cost_Efficiency, Date, and Product_Profitability.', assumptions=['Products with significantly lower cost efficiency may indicate inefficiencies in production or distribution processes.', 'Outliers in cost efficiency data could be attributed to changes in market conditions, promotional activities, or operational issues.'], scope='This analysis will focus on identifying outliers in cost efficiency data for all products, providing a high-level view of financial performance. It does not include an in-depth investigation of the root causes for the observed outliers.', context='This data story applies to the telecommunications industry, specifically within the product management and finance departments, where understanding product cost efficiency is crucial for strategic decision-making.', possible_insights=['Identification of underperforming products based on cost efficiency.', 'Detection of potential issues in production or distribution processes.', 'Awareness of market conditions or promotional activities impacting cost efficiency.'], possible_outcomes=['Implementation of corrective actions to improve cost efficiency for underperforming products.', 'Adjustment of resource allocation based on product performance insights.', 'Initiation of further investigations to address outliers and their underlying causes.'])

Database Schema:
CREATE TABLE "starhub_data_asset.data_asset_001_pcc" (
    `Product` text,
    `Revenue_Generation` int,
    `Cost_Efficiency` double,
    `Product_Profitability` double,
    `Date` text
);

/* Given the following database description: */
 This fact table stores data related to product performance, tracking metrics such as revenue generation, cost efficiency, and product profitability. Each row represents a unique combination of product and date, providing a detailed view of performance over time. The table is a core component for financial and operational analysis, enabling data-driven decision-making for product strategy and resource allocation. By offering a quantitative perspective on product success, it supports the identification of trends, strengths, and areas for improvement.

/* Given the following database column description: */
Product: The Product column identifies the specific product or service being analyzed for cost efficiency, product profitability, and revenue generation.
Revenue_Generation: Revenue_Generation represents the total income generated by a product or service, typically measured over a specific period of time.
Cost_Efficiency: Cost_Efficiency indicates the cost-effectiveness of a product or process, reflecting the balance between the resources used and the outcomes achieved.
Product_Profitability: Product_Profitability measures the profitability of a particular product, reflecting the difference between its revenues and costs.
Date: The Date column represents the specific timepoint for which the cost efficiency, product profitability, and revenue generation data are reported.








'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pyramidfunnel_chart', and 'pie_chart' consist of 'xAxis' and 'yAxis' columns only where 'xAxis' must be from a database column with string / numerical / date data type, and 'yAxis' must be from a database column with numerical data type.
    'histogram_chart' consist of 'xAxis' column only where 'xAxis' must be from a database column with numerical data type.
    'area_chart', 'line_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', 'grouped_bar_chart', 'radar_chart', and 'TreemapMulti_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxis', 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' columns only. 'xAxis' must from a database column with string / numerical / date data type, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' column is not mandatory.
    'spline_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxis', 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' columns only. 'xAxis' must from a database column with numerical / date data type only, while 'yAxis', 'yAxis2', and 'y3Axis' must be from a database column with numerical data type. 'y2Axis', 'y3Axis', and 'series' column is not mandatory.
    'barlinecombo_chart' consist of 'xAxis', 'yAxisBar', 'yAxisLine' columns only.
    'table_chart' consist of all columns needed by the question.

'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

Lastly, we will analyze the product's profitability, comparing the revenues and costs for each quarter to identify any trends or patterns. This comprehensive analysis will provide valuable insights into the BroadBand product's financial health and performance trends.", assumptions=['An increase in revenue generation may lead to improved product profitability, assuming other factors such as cost efficiency remain constant', 'Seasonal fluctuations in consumer demand may impact revenue generation and cost efficiency, affecting the overall product profitability'], scope='The analysis is limited to the BroadBand product and its financial performance over the four quarters of 2022.', context='This data story applies to the telecommunications industry, specifically within the product and finance departments, where understanding the financial performance of individual products is crucial for strategic decision-making.', possible_insights=['Identification of quarters with the highest and lowest revenue generation and profitability', 'Detection of any seasonal trends in revenue, cost efficiency, and profitability', 'Comparison of revenue and cost efficiency to assess their impact on overall profitability'], possible_outcomes=['Informed resource allocation decisions based on product performance trends', 'Data-driven product strategy development, accounting for seasonal fluctuations and financial performance', 'Enhanced financial tracking and monitoring for the BroadBand product, facilitating continuous improvement'])

Database Schema:
CREATE TABLE "starhub_data_asset.data_asset_001_pcc" (
    `Product` text,
    `Revenue_Generation` int,
    `Cost_Efficiency` double,
    `Product_Profitability` double,
    `Date` text
);

/* Given the following database description: */
 This fact table stores data related to product performance, tracking metrics such as revenue generation, cost efficiency, and product profitability. Each row represents a unique combination of product and date, providing a detailed view of performance over time. The table is a core component for financial and operational analysis, enabling data-driven decision-making for product strategy and resource allocation. By offering a quantitative perspective on product success, it supports the identification of trends, strengths, and areas for improvement.

/* Given the following database column description: */
Product: The Product column identifies the specific product or service being analyzed for cost efficiency, product profitability, and revenue generation.
Revenue_Generation: Revenue_Generation represents the total income generated by a product or service, typically measured over a specific period of time.
Cost_Efficiency: Cost_Efficiency indicates the cost-effectiveness of a product or process, reflecting the balance between the resources used and the outcomes achieved.
Product_Profitability: Product_Profitability measures the profitability of a particular product, reflecting the difference between its revenues and costs.
Date: The Date column represents the specific timepoint for which the cost efficiency, product profitability, and revenue generation data are reported.

'Product' = ['Broadband']
'Date' = ['2022-Q1', '2022-Q2', '2022-Q3', '2022-Q4']

system_prompt:
As an experienced data analyst, based on the provided database schema and user query, create main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types that answer key aspects of the data storytelling plan.

Ensure all main questions, main chart titles, and main chart types meet these criterias:

Generate main questions and main chart titles related to the narrative flow of the data story.
Be free from redundant questions and informations.
Each main question and main chart title should result in a visualization containing up to 12 rows when converted into an SQL query.
Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

SELECT the MOST SUITABLE main chart type ONLY from the supported chart type list below.

- barlinecombo_chart
- line_chart
- spline_chart
- bar_chart
- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

StorySkeleton(objectives='The primary objective of this analysis is to compare the revenue and cost forecasts for Entertainment and Mobile services for the current quarter, providing a clear understanding of the financial performance in these areas.', storytelling_flow='Comparative Flow', audiences='Senior management, financial analysts, and decision-makers within the telecommunications industry who are interested in understanding the financial performance of Entertainment and Mobile services.', narrative_flow='Beginning with an overview of the total revenues and costs for Entertainment and Mobile services, we will delve into the details of each service category. CREATE TABLE "starhub_data_asset.data_asset_001_forecast" (
    `Revenue_Entertainment` int,
    `Revenue_Mobile` int,

    `Versions` text,
    `Cost_Entertainment` int,
    `Revenue_Broadband` int,
    `Cost_Mobile` int,
    `Cost_Broadband` int
);

/* Given the following database description: */
 This fact table stores forecast data related to different services offered by a company. It includes revenue and cost forecasts for broadband, entertainment, and mobile services. The 'Versions' column represents different versions of the forecast. The 'Date' column indicates the time period the forecast covers. This table is essential for financial planning and analysis, providing a comprehensive view of expected revenues and costs for each service category.

/* Given the following database column description: */
Revenue_Entertainment: Revenue_Entertainment is the revenue generated from entertainment services in a given period.
Revenue_Mobile: Revenue_Mobile is the revenue generated from mobile services in a given period.
Date: Date represents the date for which the data is reported.
Versions: Versions refer to different iterations or versions of the data asset.
Cost_Entertainment: Cost_Entertainment is the cost associated with providing entertainment services in a given period.
Revenue_Broadband: Revenue_Broadband is the revenue generated from broadband services in a given period.
Cost_Mobile: Cost_Mobile is the cost associated with providing mobile services in a given period.
Cost_Broadband: Cost_Broadband is the cost associated with providing broadband services in a given period.

Be free from redundant questions and informations.

Avoid asking redundant or overly simplistic questions or chart titles (such as those resulting in a single-value response).
Never start the sub questions with `which`.
NEVER CHOOSE ANY OTHER CHART TYPES outside from the chart type list.
NEVER GENERATE a question where the answer or required information is/are not exist in the database schema.
NEVER generate similar chart titles.
NEVER filter the question with certain column if not required.
ALWAYS INDICATE CONSISTENT TIME DURATIONS (e.g., 'past two years', 'last month', 'previous quarter') in each main question and chart title.
If the main question that you generate is related to date, ENSURE ALWAYS INCLUDES a CONSISTENT CLEARLY INDICATED TIME FRAME in the main question and main chart title, such as daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually, or yearly.
ENSURE the main questions generated NEVER HAVE REDUNDANCY or repetition, and strive to introduce more VARIATIONS in the main questions.
CONSISTENTLY INCORPORATE AGGREGATION METRICS like sum, average, count, and total in all generated main questions for accurate analysis.
NEVER USE 'scatter_chart'.
If any categorical column is involved, USE a 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' instead, with the chart type set to 'histogram_chart' for distribution within the category.
EXCLUDE categorical labels in the question and title when considering the use of a 'histogram_chart'.
NEVER CHOOSE 'histogram_chart' for exact date x-axis.
NEVER FORCE to generate the next main question if the next main question generated will result in duplicate chart or chart with only different time duration.

- barlinecombo_chart

- spline_chart

- column_chart
- grouped_column_chart
- grouped_bar_chart
- radar_chart
- table_chart
- histogram_chart
- area_chart
- pie_chart
- pyramidfunnel_chart
- TreemapMulti_chart

NEVER USE CHART TYPE OTHER THAN THE LIST ABOVE!

Follow the suitable chart type criteria below to select the most suitable chart type.

'barlinecombo_chart' is suitable for comparing exactly two metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'line_chart', and 'area_chart' are suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame.
'spline_chart' is suitable for comparing one until three metrics within the same time duration and time frame through smoothen line(s).
'bar_chart', 'column_chart', 'pie_chart', and 'pyramidfunnel_chart' are suitable for comparing only one metric.
'grouped_bar_chart', 'grouped_column_chart', and 'radar_chart' are suitable for comparing two to three metrics within the same categories. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for single metric comparison instead of 'grouped_bar_chart' or 'grouped_column_chart'.
'table_chart' is suitable for comparing one or more metrics in detail.
'histogram_chart' is suitable for visualizing frequency distribution of ONLY ONE SINGLE NUMERICAL METRIC in bins for only one single distribution. Exclude any categorical labels from the question and title for histogram chart. Choose 'bar_chart' or 'column_chart' for distribution within categories instead of 'histogram_chart'. 
'TreemapMulti_chart' is suitable for comparing two or more categories.

Cost_Entertainment: Cost_Entertainment is the cost associated with providing entertainment services in a given period.
Revenue_Broadband: Revenue_Broadband is the revenue generated from broadband services in a given period.
Cost_Mobile: Cost_Mobile is the cost associated with providing mobile services in a given period.
Cost_Broadband: Cost_Broadband is the cost associated with providing broadband services in a given period.
